channel.title: Subjective

description.p: A conversational, interview-style series that explores influencial writers, software developers and graphic artists who are making an impact on the creative arts.

channel.itunes:author: Victor Wynne
channel.itunes:summary: A conversational, interview-style series that explores influencial writers, software developers and graphic artists who are making an impact on the creative arts.

item.title: 1: 'The Maiden Voyage', with Daniel Tomlinson

description.p: Daniel describes his interest in software development, then our thoughts on the Apple Watch, Apple Pay in the UK, Apple's release cycles, App Store pricing, upgrades and software quality, Swift, CocoaCasts, and Overcast is discussed in the after show.

item.itunes:summary: Daniel describes his interest in software development, then our thoughts on the Apple Watch, Apple Pay in the UK, Apple's release cycles, App Store pricing, upgrades and software quality, Swift, CocoaCasts, and Overcast is discussed in the after show.

item.title: 2: '17,000 Dollars', with Josh Centers

description.p: Josh describes his role at TidBITS, then we cover Apple's 'Spring Forward' event; Apple TV and HBO, Apple Watch pricing and the value of the materials, finally we have the new 12" MacBook, and the Force Touch trackpad.

item.itunes:summary: Josh describes his role at TidBITS, then we cover Apple's 'Spring Forward' event; Apple TV and HBO, Apple Watch pricing and the value of the materials, finally we have the new 12" MacBook, and the Force Touch trackpad.

item.title: 3: 'A Light Tug', with George Tinari

description.p: We discuss Fantastical 2 for Mac, George expresses his feelings about TUAW, his employer, shutting down, potential Apple Watch use cases, 12" MacBook critiques and Apple's product lineup, the future of iPad and an update to the Apple TV.

item.itunes:summary: We discuss Fantastical 2 for Mac, George expresses his feelings about TUAW, his employer, shutting down, potential Apple Watch use cases, 12" MacBook critiques and Apple's product lineup, the future of iPad and an update to the Apple TV.

item.title: 4: 'Dreaming About Skyboxes', with Eric Trowbridge

description.p: Eric explains managing the Apple retail experience, then Apple pivots to being a fashion accessories company, a look at Phoenix Dawn and apixal, low poly mesh, the Unity engine, Metal and Swift, and app pricing vs IAP.

item.itunes:summary: Eric explains managing the Apple retail experience, then Apple pivots to being a fashion accessories company, a look at Phoenix Dawn and apixal, low poly mesh, the Unity engine, Metal and Swift, and app pricing vs IAP.

item.title: 5: 'Modern Minimalism', with Eli Schiff

description.p: Eli discusses his Critical Sharks series, App Store policies and the developer environment, the aesthetics and functionality of OS X and iOS, and more Apple Watch discussion, of course.

item.itunes:summary: Eli discusses his Critical Sharks series, App Store policies and the developer environment, the aesthetics and functionality of OS X and iOS, and more Apple Watch discussion, of course.

item.title: 6: 'The Mythical Mid-range Mac Minitower', with Dan Frakes

description.p: Dan reminisces on starting at Macworld, and his transition to The Wirecutter, then some WWDC discussion, Force Touch Trackpad, Apple TV and HomeKit, the Mac Medium, Photos for Mac and iCloud Photo Library, and the Apple Watch.

item.itunes:summary: Dan reminisces on starting at Macworld, and his transition to The Wirecutter, then some WWDC discussion, Force Touch Trackpad, Apple TV and HomeKit, the Mac Medium, Photos for Mac and iCloud Photo Library, and the Apple Watch.

item.title: 7: 'The Honeycomb is Odd', with Matthew Bischoff

description.p: Matthew discusses his contributions to the Tumblr app for iOS, Quotebook and Velocity at Lickability, iOS 9 and OS X 10.11 at WWDC 2015, Microsoft Visual Studio Code, thoughts on the Apple Watch, and Watch OS.

item.itunes:summary: Matthew discusses his contributions to the Tumblr app for iOS, Quotebook and Velocity at Lickability, iOS 9 and OS X 10.11 at WWDC 2015, Microsoft Visual Studio Code, thoughts on the Apple Watch, and Watch OS.

item.title: 8: 'Just the Way it Works', with Joe Darnell

description.p: Joe joins Victor to discuss some of the aspects of podcasting, while Victor announces some changes to the show's format, with digressions on the presence of women in tech, and their representation on podcasts, classic video games, and the Apple Watch.

item.itunes:summary: Joe joins Victor to discuss some of the aspects of podcasting, while Victor announces some changes to the show's format, with digressions on the presence of women in tech, and their representation on podcasts, classic video games, and the Apple Watch.

item.title: 9: 'Free as in Liberty', with Laura Kalbag

description.p: Laura shares her upbringing in England, and how she was introduced to web-based graphic arts, and front end development. Then we discuss the importance of web standards, accessibility and how Ind.ie hopes to combat the data mining practices of Silicon Valley.

item.itunes:summary: Laura shares her upbringing in England, and how she was introduced to web-based graphic arts, and front end development. Then we discuss the importance of web standards, accessibility and how Ind.ie hopes to combat the data mining practices of Silicon Valley.

item.title: 10: 'I Don't Want to Touch It', with Emiel Janson

description.p: Emiel shares his upbringing in the Netherlands, being introduced to computers by using his father's Mac, and how he began developing websites and software for the Mac and iOS. We then dive into the various freelance projects he has been an integral part of, the work he is doing at Blendle, and because we couldn't help ourselves...we discuss the Apple Watch at great length.

item.itunes:summary: Emiel shares his upbringing in the Netherlands, being introduced to computers by using his father's Mac, and how he began developing websites and software for the Mac and iOS. We then dive into the various freelance projects he has been an integral part of, the work he is doing at Blendle, and because we couldn't help ourselves...we discuss the Apple Watch at great length.
